results.title: Odd jobs
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Ryan, Jonathon Green and Daniel Nettheim
results.brief_description: Two Boy Scouts, intent on earning money by doing odd jobs, stumble upon a spooky old house and its macabre owner. He looks forward to scaring them with his “house of horrors” - but young boys today aren’t so easily frightened.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AFTRS, Andrew Ryan, Jonathon Green and Daniel Nettheim

results.title: It's a living
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, David Poltorak and Laurie Kirkwood
results.brief_description: Driving a taxi is not so bad if you’re really an actor researching a part or a writer looking for material. Features a cameo by Australian great, Jack Thompson. Original format 16mm.

results.title: Cherith
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Francine Penrose and Shirley Barrett
results.brief_description: Not being able to speak in tongues can be embarrassing at the very best of times. But if you are the only member of the congregation who cannot, and you are the daughter of a dynamic Revivalist preacher like Pastor Howard Spong - it’s even more distressing. And that’s just one of Cherith’s problems. This is a serious (and satirical) comedy about fundamentalist religion. This distinguished piece of film making, with a great script, direction and performance, won Best Short Fiction Film, AFI Awards in 1988.

results.title: Caravan park
results.brief_description: When their car breaks down on the way to Queensland, a family is forced to take up residence at a caravan park while the father tries to earn enough money to get the car repaired. Much of the film is seen through the eyes of their young son as he comes to realise some of the complexities of his parents’ relationship. Great realist film from the director of ‘Patriot Games’ (1992), ‘The Bone Collector’ (1999) and ‘Rabbit-Proof Fence’ (2002). Based on the story by John Emery. Photography by Tom Cowan, editing by Anthony Buckley and production assistant, Gillian Armstrong. Original Format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: The Bus trip
results.brief_description: Ever gone on a trip and thought that maybe you left the oven on at home? In this entertaining film these kinds of speculations turn a simple cross country bus trip into a nightmare. Original Format 35mm/colour.

results.title: Tran the man
results.creator_credit: Siobhan Hannan, Rowan Woods and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Ray Moss has been nicknamed “Tran” by his Asian workmates in his job as a security guard at a shopping centre in suburban Cabramatta. For Ray, the heat is on. His brother Donny and Uncle Jack have had their heroin business undercut by Asian-controlled competition in Cabramatta and Donny and Jack want Ray as their go-between. Cast features David Wenham as Ray/”Tran”.

results.title: Guru
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Pascal Guilloux and Safina Uberoi
results.brief_description: In the West, people fall in love and then get married. In India, people get married and then fall in love. But this is not India - this is Parramatta, in Sydney, Australia…A film celebrating cultural clashes amidst a wild and wonderful festival of colour. Original format 16 mm.

results.title: Love at first sight
results.brief_description: An unhappy couple plan a special anniversary dinner but neither realises just how “special” the other has made it. A new husband discovers that he is just the latest in a long line of young men that his powerful older wife has seduced. A gigolo versus black widow battle of the sexes from the director of ‘Babe’ (1995). Cast features June Salter and Richard Moir. Original format 16mm/black and white.
